intro: Microstegium brandisii, commonly known as the Brandis's wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. Native to southern Africa, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant has a creeping growth habit with stolons that root at the nodes, allowing it to spread vegetatively. Its flowers are typically short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday.
